---------------------------------------------------------------------

Finally! As of 2014, Lick My Decals Off, Baby, The Spotlight Kid, and Clear Spot had needed a proper remastering treatment for quite some time when Rhino came to the rescue, remastering all three in one fell swoop as Sun Zoom Spark: 1970 to 1972. As if that werenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t enough for fans, they added an entire bonus disc of outtakes and alternates as well. The albums themselves are fairly different from each other. Lick My Decals followed directly after Trout Mask Replica and is the closest there is to Trout MaskÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s sonic assault. On the other side, Clear SpotÃ¢â‚¬Ëœs horn charts, backup singers, and Ted Templeman production were probably catchy enough for actual radio success (well, maybe in a better world). The Spotlight Kid is pitched somewhere in between. However, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s all prime Beefheart. The band is always in sync, DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s voice sounds great (as does his harmonica playing), and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s all got that unique rhythmic sense. The bonus material doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t disappoint either. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s all from the Clear Spot and Spotlight Kid sessions and sounds fantastic. The alternates of songs that were on the albums are interesting but not revelatory, but hearing these early versions of songs that appeared on later albums is pretty fascinating. This version of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Harry IreneÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ predates both the Shiny Beast version and the Bat Chain Puller version. The two takes of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Dirty Blue GeneÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ are quite interesting as well, not just because theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re significantly different than the version that ended up on Doc at the Radar Station but also because theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re significantly different from each other (the third take is quite a bit more aggressive, with a really cool guitar tone at the end). Ã¢â‚¬Å“Pompadour SwampÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is a great guitar instrumental that ended up as Ã¢â‚¬Å“Suction Prints.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s hard to believe some of these cuts were left off originally, but albums were shorter back in the day. They make this set pretty close to essential for longtime fans (as if the fantastic sound werenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t enough).
